text.content:
Patient reports to triage c/c depression for more than 2 weeks.  "I just need 
some help"
 
Patient acknowledges that she is currently hopeless, thinking about suicide 
daily and has a plan.  Per policy, pt walked back to ER bed.  Chrage Nurse 
notified.  Report to ER nurse Smith.
 
PHQ2 and PHQ 9 completed while pt was in triage.
 
  Depression Screening:
    PHQ-2
      A PHQ-2 screen was performed. The score was 6 which is a positive
          screen for depression.
 
          1. Little interest or pleasure in doing things
          Nearly every day
 
          2. Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
          Nearly every day
    PHQ-9
      A PHQ-9 screen was performed. The score was 23 which is suggestive
          of severe depression.
 
          1. Little interest or pleasure in doing things
          Nearly every day
 
          2. Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
          Nearly every day
 
          3. Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
          More than half the days
 
          4. Feeling tired or having little energy
          Nearly every day
 
          5. Poor appetite or overeating
          More than half the days
 
          6. Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure or have
          let yourself or your family down
          Nearly every day
 
          7. Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the
          newspaper or watching television
          More than half the days
 
          8. Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have
          noticed. Or the opposite being so fidgety or restless that you
          have been moving around a lot more than usual
          Nearly every day
 
          9. Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting
          yourself in some way
          More than half the days
 
          10. If you checked off any problems, how DIFFICULT have these
          problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at
          home or get along with other people?
          Very difficult
 
 
--------------------
PROBLEM LIST:
Computerized Problem List is the source for the following: 
 
1. Obesity, Onset 00/00/04                            05/30/12  AVIVAUSER,THIRT
2. Hyperlipidemia                                     09/22/09  PROVIDER,ONE 
3. Diabetes Mellitus Type II or unspecified, Onset    05/10/12  PROVIDER,ONE 
00/00/05 
     Adequate control on oral medications.
     Goal to lose 50 pounds in 1 year.
4. Osteopenia, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
5. Postsurgical hypothyroidism, Onset 00/00/02        05/10/12  PROVIDER,ONE 
     Complete thryoidectomy for thyroid cancer in 2002.
6. Depression, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
7. Hypertension, Onset 00/00/05                       11/09/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
 
------------
MEDICATIONS:
Active Inpatient and Outpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 
     Outpatient Medications                                 Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB TAKE 500 MG    ACTIVE
       BY MOUTH THREE TIMES A DAY
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB TAKE 12.5 MG  BY MOUTH EVERY   ACTIVE
       DAY
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
5)   GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB TAKE ONE      ACTIVE
       TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
7)   LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
8)   SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY    ACTIVE
       EVENING
9)   VENLAFAXINE HCL 37.5MG TAB TAKE TWO TABLETS BY MOUTH   ACTIVE
       TWICE A DAY
 
ALLERGIES/ADRS:
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
text.author: AVIVAUSER,TWENTYNINE
